intro: Maughania, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, including countries like Vietnam and Thailand. The plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, characterized by their evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. Maughania species are often found in humid, shaded environments, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Their botanical significance lies in their ecological role and potential medicinal uses.
